metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20807 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode andexecute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby,or Lua).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.4').
